paragraphs.text: This letter shall serve as a statement of Kristine Allen's damages as a result of the above-referenced loss. Enclosed for your review, please find a copy of medical and billing records reflecting the treatment she received as a result of her collision caused by your insured.

On May 24, 2024, Ms. Allen was a passenger in the front seat of her husband's vehicle in the city of Irvine, state of California.{footnote}   They were stopped at a traffic light on Alton and Irvine Boulevard with no vehicles in front of them when suddenly they heard a huge slam as a Prius crashed into the rear of their vehicle.  The impact was so severe that Ms. Allen had to exit the vehicle to check on the other driver, who was frantic and having difficulty getting out of her car.  Your insured, who had difficulty speaking English, admitted she had never been in an accident before and apologized for the collision.  As a result of the force and nature of the impact, Ms. Allen sustained bodily injuries necessitating medical attention.
paragraphs.footnote: Ms. Allen's husband was also present in the vehicle as the driver, but he does not appear to be making an injury claim, at least to the best of my knowledge.

paragraphs.text: After the accident occurred, Ms. Allen experienced shock followed by increasing soreness in her neck and upper back that progressively worsened throughout the day.  Despite her attempts at self-care through rest, over-the-counter medications, and massage therapy, her pain continued to intensify, compelling her to seek professional medical attention from Dr. John Chi-Chang Chen at Compassion Chiropractic.{footnote}   During her initial evaluation on June 20, 2024, Ms. Allen reported suffering from neck pain with more severity on the left side, bilateral shoulder pain that was also more pronounced on the left side, and significant mid-back discomfort, all of which were described as dull, aching sensations accompanied by muscle tightness.
paragraphs.footnote: Ms. Allen sought massage therapy at Jasmine Wellness Spa as her pain flared up and will continue to do so for an indefinite period of time.

paragraphs.text: Upon conducting his evaluation, Dr. Chen found palpable tenderness and muscle spasms in Ms. Allen's cervical, thoracic, and lumbar regions, with specific tenderness noted at several spinal levels.  Range of motion testing revealed significant limitations throughout her spine, with all movements producing pain and muscle spasms.  Orthopedic examinations showed positive results for the Cervical Compression Test, Distraction Test, Shoulder Depression Test, Single Leg Raise Test, Bilateral Leg Raise Test, Milgrim's Test, and Kemp's Test, all of which reproduced Ms. Allen's chief complaints.  X-rays of the cervical and lumbar spine revealed a loss of cervical lordosis, though no fractures or dislocations were present.  Ms. Allen was diagnosed with the following:
A Cervical Sprain due to a Motor Vehicle Accident;
A Thoracic Ligamentous Sprain due to a Motor Vehicle Accident;
Muscle Spasms in her Back;
Cervical Segmental Dysfunction;
Thoracic Segmental Dysfunction; and
Lumbar Segmental Dysfunction.

As a result of the above, Dr. Chen recommended that Ms. Allen receive chiropractic rehabilitation including joint manipulation, soft tissue manipulation, cervical spine distraction, and physical therapy modalities such as electrical muscle stimulation, ultrasound, and traction.  He also prescribed a home exercise program consisting of active range of motion exercises for the cervical and lumbar spine along with passive stretches for neck and lower back muscles.  By October 4, 2024, Ms. Allen experienced only slight improvement in her pain as tightness was still evident over the upper trapezius muscles and at spinal levels C6, C7, T1 and L5.

While receiving care from Dr. Chen, Ms. Allen was referred to SimonMed to obtain an MRI of her cervical spine on September 5, 2024.  The MRI revealed significant findings including a 3 mm disc extrusion at her C5-C6 region with mild to moderate spinal canal narrowing and mild ventral cord flattening.  Additionally, there was mild to moderate left neural foraminal narrowing and mild right neural foraminal narrowing at this same level.  The MRI also showed a broad-based 2 mm disc bulge at her C4-C5 region with mild spinal canal narrowing, as well as a 1-2 mm disc bulge at her C6-C7 region without significant spinal canal narrowing.  Further findings included mild left neural foraminal narrowing at her C3-C4 region, mild reversal of the normal cervical lordosis, and mild C5-C6 retrolisthesis.

In light of the MRI findings, Ms. Allen was referred to Dr. Khyber Zaffarkhan, a board-certified physician in Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation, with Regenerative Institute of Newport Beach.  On October 3, 2024, Ms. Allen initially consulted with Dr. Zaffarkhan and described persistent neck pain following the motor vehicle accident on May 24, 2024.  She characterized her neck pain as aching, tight, and intermittent at a level of moderate intensity, with the left side worse than the right.  Ms. Allen reported that her pain was typically worse in the morning, though she could not identify specific aggravating factors.  She indicated that massages and stretching provided some relief from her discomfort.  While her pain had improved somewhat with chiropractic therapy, she continued to experience persistent cervical discomfort.  Ms. Allen also reported functional limitations, noting that she was no longer able to lift weights due to her pain, and that her work as an IT manager was impacted as she required frequent breaks due to her neck pain.

Dr. Zaffarkhan's evaluation revealed significant physical limitations due to pain.  Ms. Allen demonstrated a positive cervical facet loading test on the left side during her physical examination.  The doctor observed that she was no longer able to lift weights due to her pain, and her work as an IT manager was impacted as she required frequent breaks due to her neck pain.  Through his thorough evaluation of her condition and review of the MRI, Dr. Zaffarkhan determined that Ms. Allen's pain was significantly impacting her daily activities despite some improvement through chiropractic care.  After reviewing the results of Ms. Allen's MRI, Dr. Zaffarkhan diagnosed her with the following:
Cervical Facet Syndrome;
Cervical Herniated Disc; and
Cervical Canal Stenosis.

In light of his findings, Dr. Zaffarkhan suggested that Ms. Allen consider Extracorporeal Shockwave Therapy (ESWT) for her cervical spine or potentially cervical facet Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) injection if conservative treatments proved ineffective.  After evaluating her options during a telehealth follow-up on October 10, 2024, Ms. Allen elected to proceed with ESWT treatments.

Ms. Allen began her ESWT regimen on October 29, 2024, during which she received 1,500 pulses at level 9 intensity and 2.5 Hz frequency to her cervical spine.  The treatment lasted approximately 15 minutes and her pain level decreased from moderate to mild.  She returned for her second ESWT session on November 5, 2024, receiving the same therapeutic protocol, although she reported no significant improvement following her first treatment.  Despite this initial lack of progress, Ms. Allen noted improvement after her third ESWT session conducted on November 7, 2024.

Ms. Allen followed up with Dr. Zaffarkhan on November 12, 2024, stating that the most recent visits mentioned above proved to be effective so she decided to discontinue her treatment for the time being and will return down the road should her pain flare back up.
As a result of Ms. Allen's collision caused by your insured, her life and lifestyle have been negatively impacted in the following ways:
Physical limitations forced Ms. Allen to pause her Crossfit fitness classes as she could not lift heavy weights, significantly disrupting her established workout routine and overall fitness regimen.

Sleep was severely compromised due to neck discomfort, causing Ms. Allen to wake up with a sore neck and preventing her from sleeping throughout the night, which contributed to fatigue and diminished daytime functioning.

Emotional distress manifested as anxiety, depression, and traumatic memories of the accident, leaving her constantly worried about getting hit again while driving and unable to relax due to being in a persistent fight or flight mode.
The accident negatively impacted her marriage through increased arguments, inability to be her best self, and the shifting of caregiving responsibilities to her husband during her recovery period.
Social withdrawal became prominent as Ms. Allen no longer wanted to engage socially, resulting in feelings of isolation and disconnection from her husband, friends, and family.

Family dynamics were disrupted, particularly affecting her relationship with her daughter who wanted to spend more time with her mother but could not due to Ms. Allen's condition and treatment schedule.
Ms. Allen was unable to attend after-school activities for her daughter, which compromised important parent-child bonding opportunities and participation in her daughter's development.
Household duties and responsibilities such as washing dishes, taking out trash, sweeping the kitchen, and cleaning bathrooms could not be performed, creating additional burden on family members.
Work performance suffered as Ms. Allen could not sit for long periods during work meetings due to soreness and pain, creating professional challenges and potential career setbacks.
Focus and concentration at work were severely compromised for several weeks following the accident, requiring Ms. Allen to spend extra time catching up with work responsibilities.
The total cost of Ms. Allen's treatment as a result of the collision at issue is $13,960.20, and is broken down as follows:
Massages - $545.00;
Compassion Chiropractic - $4,630.00;
Superior Imaging - $2,243.00; and
Regenerative Institute Of Newport Beach - $6,542.20.{footnote}
paragraphs.footnote: The charges for the late rescheduling noted on the invoice have been removed from the figure noted above.

paragraphs.text: Factoring in the discomfort, uneasiness, and inconvenience Ms. Allen experienced, along with her pain and suffering, the nature of the trauma she sustained, the effect of the collision on her day-to-day life (as described in detail above), her likely need for future care (particularly in light of the results of her cervical MRI showing a 3mm disc extrusion at C5-C6 with moderate spinal canal narrowing and mild ventral cord flattening), and her greater susceptibility to future injuries of the type she sustained, Ms. Allen requests $44,332.51 in exchange for a full and complete release of any and all liability resulting from the above-referenced loss.
Please respond to the above request by no later than Friday, December 19, 2025.
Should you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to contact me.
Sincerely,
/s/ Deep Trikannad
DEEP TRIKANNAD
Encl.: As stated
